Diragukan Sukses sebagai Mendikbud, Nadiem: Ini Jadi Energi Saya
06 Nov 2019, 17:05 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Dilantiknya Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nadiem Makarim menimbulkam banyak komentar masyarakat. Tidak sedikit yang meragukan kapasitasnya yang merupakan mantan pimpinan perusahaan teknologi GoJek.
"Saya pribadi suka hal rumit dan sulit, semakin banyak orang bilang enggak mungkin, enggak bisa, saya senang dengan itu," ujar Nadiem dalam rapat kerja Kemendikbud dengan anggota DPR Komisi X di Komplek Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
"Dulu juga seperti itu, itu menjadi energi buat saya, sehingga semakin lebih ingin mengatasi masalahnya."
Nadiem ditunjuk Presiden Jokowi sebagai Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan dalam kabinet Indonesia Maju, Rabu, 23 Oktober 2019. Nadiem menggantikan Mendikbud lama Muhadjir Effendy.
Dalam rapat kerja perdananya, Nadiem memaparkan lima arahan visi dan misi Presiden Jokowi dalam menciptakan SDM unggul dan sejumlah program kerja Kemendikbud.
"Ada lima arahan visi dan misi dari Pak Presiden yang selanjutnya saya kembangkan yaitu pendidikan karakter, deregulasi dan debirokratisasi, meningkatkan investasi dan inovasi, penciptaan lapangan kerja, dan pemberdayaan teknologi," tutur Nadiem.
Nadiem juga menyatakan apa yang disampaikan Presiden Jokowi kepada dirinya bahwa pendidikan di Indonesia perlu lompatan besar.
"Menurut Presiden Jokowi di pendidikan perlu adanya lompatan, kalau diam di tempat itu bahaya. Untuk mencapai lompatan itu pasti ada kegagalan, tapi kalau diam di tempat itu kegagalan sebenarnya. Jadi harus maju," kata Nadiem.

Doubtful of Success as Minister of Education and Culture, Nadiem: This Becomes My Energy
06 Nov 2019, 17:05 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Inauguration of Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem Makarim has caused a lot of public comments. Not a few who doubted the capacity of a former GoJek technology company leader.
"I personally like complicated and difficult things, more and more people say it's impossible, I can't, I'm happy with it," Nadiem said at a Ministry of Education and Culture meeting with members of the House of Representatives Commission X at the Senayan Complex, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
"It used to be like that too, it became energy for me, so that I increasingly wanted to overcome the problem."
Nadiem was appointed by President Jokowi as Minister of Education and Culture in the Advanced Indonesia cabinet, Wednesday, October 23, 2019. Nadiem replaced the old Minister of Education and Culture Muhadjir Effendy.
In his inaugural work meeting, Nadiem explained five directions of President Jokowi's vision and mission in creating superior human resources and a number of work programs of the Ministry of Education and Culture.
"There are five directions of the vision and mission of the President that I further develop, namely character education, deregulation and bureaucratization, increasing investment and innovation, job creation, and technology empowerment," said Nadiem.
Nadiem also stated what President Jokowi said to himself that education in Indonesia needed a big leap.
"According to President Jokowi in education there needs to be a leap, if staying in that place is dangerous. To achieve that jump there must be a failure, but if staying in that place is a real failure. So we must move forward," Nadiem said.
